Posts.Content: If the problem with the fosamax was from esophageal/gastro irritation, there is a bisphosphonate (Zeledronic acid) that is given by I.V. every 6 months or so. It is often given to women who can't tolerate the oral bisphosphonates.There have also been a number of studies that have shown it also reduces the incidence of breast cancer reoccurance.
Posts.Title: significant bone loss with femara

Posts.Content: I forgot to mention that I really upped my D3 intake (I take about 3000-4000 a day) and my joint pain, trigger finger, etc have really improved. I take a number of other supplements (fish oil, Zylamend) but the D seemed to be the most helpful.
